Chapter 2993: Chapter 1558: Rejecting Shadow Saint'S Python-Whipping, Taizai Discusses Snake Soup

Chapter 2993: Chapter 1558: Rejecting Shadow Saint’s Python-Whipping, Taizai Discusses Snake Soup

“Madam Serpent has lost?”

The battle of the Twelve Holy Lords had just begun on this side when screams already echoed from not far away. Wasn’t this too quick?

Qin Guan, Kong Tong, and others were all stunned. As their saint’s will swept over, they quickly discerned the key point:

“Xu Xiaoshou is unpoisoned?”

After beheading Madam Serpent with a single sword stroke, he even managed to strike a dashing pose in front of her beheaded and blood-spewing corpse.

What kind of poisoning was this? It clearly seemed even more intense than if he had taken aphrodisiacs.

But…

Something was not right!

The reason Madam Serpent held such a high status in the eyes of the Twelve Holy Lords was not just because of who she was, but more importantly because of her strength.

Her poison was so potent that even Taizai Ci himself could be brought down face-to-face, with effects so rapid that one could hardly react and utterly unavoidable.

If given enough time, it’s conceivable that not even a dozen demi-saints present could stand against her.

If someone ensured her immortality and continuously increased the potency of her poison, it would even be worth giving a shot against the Holy Emperor himself!

And now…

She had her head split by Xu Xiaoshou in just one encounter?

Despite employing the Locust Poison, which could restrain all demi-saints, Madam Serpent was restrained by Xu Xiaoshou?

What kind of freak was this guy, did he actually possess the Power of Medicine Ancestor?

“What are you thinking about!”

Amidst his shocking thoughts, Kong Tong discovered a large blood tumor growing on his back.

It burst open, transforming into a bloody silhouette that pushed a mask with one hand and wielded the Original Sealing Spear with the other, stabbing fiercely toward the top of his head.

“Your opponent is me!”

…

Rumble rumble rumble!

All around, the sounds of demi-saints battling fiercely erupted—wind, thunder, fire, water; all manner of trickery was unleashed.

Surprisingly, in this fight of twelve against four, the Holy Lords very tactfully divided their efforts without a second thought about joining the battle near Xu Xiaoshou.

It seemed that everyone tacitly agreed; matching soldier to soldier, king to king.

Since Xu Xiaoshou appeared even more enigmatic and troublesome than Madam Serpent, it was only fitting that Taizai Ci would be the one to confront him.

“Chi chi chi…”

Blood was flowing heavily before him.

The demonic aura of the Fourth Sword swept over Madam Serpent’s entire body.

But strangely, Xu Xiaoshou didn’t see any signs of decreasing vitality on this woman.

Or perhaps it should be said differently…

“She died once, but there’s another life left!”

Viewed from the perspective of the Life Upanishad, the body of Madam Serpent tainted by demons was clearly abandoned.

After a moment of writhing, her chest burst open, revealing a head coated in thick fluid.

—Another Madam Serpent!

“Demi-saint incarnation?”

Xu Xiaoshou was astonished.

This was his first time seeing someone summon a demi-saint incarnation within the Divine Relics.

Only true bodies could enter the Divine Relics; demi-saint incarnations couldn’t even enter, let alone be summoned here unless they were refined on the spot.

Without a doubt, in theory, this method was feasible, but in practice, very few demi-saints could achieve it.

Because, as it was well known, the cost of refining a demi-saint incarnation was too exorbitant.

First, one had to Dissolve the majority of one’s power, the resources required were unimaginable, and lastly…

Time, was the critical factor!

Typically, refining a demi-saint incarnation would take decades at most and at least three to five years at the least.

Xu Xiaoshou had witnessed the fastest method of refining a demi-saint incarnation—Huang Quan had once given birth publicly, using the power of time to accelerate and strongly coalesce a demi-saint incarnation, then barely trading it for her life.

Therefore, if one could find some treasures within the Divine Relics that accelerated time, producing a demi-saint incarnation in a matter of days was indeed not a problem.

But such an action would certainly also lead to a rapid drain on one’s own vital energy, making both the original self and the demi-saint incarnation less than their best.

After all, not everyone was equipped with a passive skill.

Within the Divine Relics, whether this action was good or bad was ultimately a matter of opinion.

…

“Hiss!”

Madam Serpent spit out her tongue.

Like shedding its skin, the newly emerged Madam Serpent was completely unaffected by the injuries of the old body, fully liberating herself from the demonic aura.

However…

“You’re too slow!”

Xu Xiaoshou shook his head silently.

He had been prepared, having spied the new life form within Madam Serpent’s body through the perspective of the Life Upanishad.

If this woman had reincarnated under the flying head at a distance, she might have had a slim chance to survive.

Spit yourself out in front of me, and I would let you succeed?

“Clang—”

The Fourth Sword was drawn sharply, its tip aiming directly at the vile face smeared with foul-smelling fluid and stabbing forward.

“Don’t!”

Madam Serpent’s eyes, which burst through the viscous fluid, conveyed horror, “Xu Xiaoshou, spare me…”

Of course, Xu Xiaoshou would not spare her.

The woman seemed to have anticipated this, and at the same time, the head that had been thrown into the sky also let out a wail of the soul:

“Taizai save me—”

Sizzle!

The Fourth Sword fiercely stabbed something.

But it wasn’t Madam Serpent’s head—it had stabbed a mass of shadow extending in the air.

“Shadow…”

Upon Perception, Xu Xiaoshou realized that at some undefined moment, a large distance had opened between himself and Madam Serpent, as if someone had pushed both apart from the middle.

But this was not quite accurate.

Because if something against his own will happened, like some sort of Guidance, Xu Xiaoshou would have noticed.

The oddity lay in that “shadow”!

Indeed, ever since he had entered this heavenly chasm, Xu Xiaoshou had noticed that the ground here was completely shrouded in shadow.

ำAs if a Raging Giant stood here, its cast shadow enveloping everything.
